Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּשַׁלַּ֣ח פַּרְעֹה֮ אֶת־הָעָם֒ וְלֹא־נָחָ֣ם אֱלֹהִ֗ים דֶּ֚רֶךְ אֶ֣רֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים כִּ֥י קָר֖וֹב ה֑וּא כִּ֣י אָמַ֣ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים פֶּֽן־יִנָּחֵ֥ם הָעָ֛ם בִּרְאֹתָ֥ם מִלְחָמָ֖ה וְשָׁ֥בוּ מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
Translit: vayhî bəshallaḥ parʿōh ʾeth-håʿåm vəlōʾ-nåḥåm ʾelōhîm derekh ʾeretṣ pəlishtîm kî qårōv hūʾ kî ʾåmar ʾelōhîm pen-yinnåḥēm håʿåm birʾōthåm milḥåmåh vəshåvū mitṣråymåh
English: And it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God led them not through the way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near; for God said, Lest peradventure the people repent when they see war, and they return to Egypt:

Hebrew: וַיַּסֵּ֨ב אֱלֹהִ֧ים אֶת־הָעָ֛ם דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר יַם־ס֑וּף וַחֲמֻשִׁ֛ים עָל֥וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyassēv ʾelōhîm ʾeth-håʿåm derekh hammidhbår yam-sūf vaḥamushîm ʿålū vənē-yisråʾēl mēʾeretṣ mitṣråyim
English: But God led the people about, through the way of the wilderness of the Red sea: and the children of Israel went up harnessed out of the land of Egypt.

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־עַצְמ֥וֹת יוֹסֵ֖ף עִמּ֑וֹ כִּי֩ הַשְׁבֵּ֨עַ הִשְׁבִּ֜יעַ אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר פָּקֹ֨ד יִפְקֹ֤ד אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהַעֲלִיתֶ֧ם אֶת־עַצְמֹתַ֛י מִזֶּ֖ה אִתְּכֶֽם׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ mōsheh ʾeth-ʿatṣmōth yōsēf ʿimmō kî hashbēaʿ hishbîaʿ ʾeth-bənē yisråʾēl lēʾmōr påqōdh yifqōdh ʾelōhîm ʾethkhem vəhaʿalîthem ʾeth-ʿatṣmōthai mizzeh ʾittəkhem
English: And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him: for he had straitly sworn the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you; and ye shall carry up my bones away hence with you.

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִסֻּכֹּ֑ת וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ בְאֵתָ֔ם בִּקְצֵ֖ה הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translit: vayyisʿū missukkōth vayyaḥanū vəʾēthåm biqtṣēh hammidhbår
English: And they took their journey from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, in the edge of the wilderness.

Hebrew: וַֽיהוָ֡ה הֹלֵךְ֩ לִפְנֵיהֶ֨ם יוֹמָ֜ם בְּעַמּ֤וּד עָנָן֙ לַנְחֹתָ֣ם הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְלַ֛יְלָה בְּעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ לְהָאִ֣יר לָהֶ֑ם לָלֶ֖כֶת יוֹמָ֥ם וָלָֽיְלָה׃
Translit: vaʾdhōnåi hōlēkh lifnēhem yōmåm bəʿammūdh ʿånån lanḥōthåm hadderekh vəlaylåh bəʿammūdh ʾēsh ləhåʾîr låhem lålekheth yōmåm vålåylåh
English: And the LORD went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them the way; and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light; to go by day and night:

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יָמִ֞ישׁ עַמּ֤וּד הֶֽעָנָן֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וְעַמּ֥וּד הָאֵ֖שׁ לָ֑יְלָה לִפְנֵ֖י הָעָֽם׃
Translit: lōʾ-yåmîsh ʿammūdh heʿånån yōmåm vəʿammūdh håʾēsh låylåh lifnē håʿåm-
English: He took not away the pillar of the cloud by day, nor the pillar of fire by night, from before the people.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְיָשֻׁ֗בוּ וְיַחֲנוּ֙ לִפְנֵי֙ פִּ֣י הַחִירֹ֔ת בֵּ֥ין מִגְדֹּ֖ל וּבֵ֣ין הַיָּ֑ם לִפְנֵי֙ בַּ֣עַל צְפֹ֔ן נִכְח֥וֹ תַחֲנ֖וּ עַל־הַיָּֽם׃
Translit: dabbēr ʾel-bənē yisråʾēl vəyåshuvū vəyaḥanū lifnē pî haḥîrōth bēn mighdōl ūvēn hayyåm lifnē baʿal tṣəfōn nikhḥō thaḥanū ʿal-hayyåm
English: Speak unto the children of Israel, that they turn and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, over against Baal-zephon: before it shall ye encamp by the sea.

Hebrew: וְאָמַ֤ר פַּרְעֹה֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נְבֻכִ֥ים הֵ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ סָגַ֥ר עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translit: vəʾåmar parʿōh livnē yisråʾēl nəvukhîm hēm båʾåretṣ såghar ʿalēhem hammidhbår
English: For Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, They are entangled in the land, the wilderness hath shut them in.

Hebrew: וְחִזַּקְתִּ֣י אֶת־לֵב־פַּרְעֹה֮ וְרָדַ֣ף אַחֲרֵיהֶם֒ וְאִכָּבְדָ֤ה בְּפַרְעֹה֙ וּבְכָל־חֵיל֔וֹ וְיָדְע֥וּ מִצְרַ֖יִם כִּֽי־אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵֽן׃
Translit: vəḥizzaqtî ʾeth-lēv-parʿōh vərådhaf ʾaḥarēhem vəʾikkåvdhåh bəfarʿōh ūvəkhål-ḥēlō vəyådhʿū mitṣrayim kî-ʾanî ʾadhōnåi vayyaʿasū-khēn
English: And I will harden Pharaoh's heart, that he shall follow after them; and I will be honoured upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host; that the Egyptians may know that I am the LORD. And they did so.

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּד֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם כִּ֥י בָרַ֖ח הָעָ֑ם וַ֠יֵּהָפֵךְ לְבַ֨ב פַּרְעֹ֤ה וַעֲבָדָיו֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם וַיֹּֽאמרוּ֙ מַה־זֹּ֣את עָשִׂ֔ינוּ כִּֽי־שִׁלַּ֥חְנוּ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵעָבְדֵֽנוּ׃
Translit: vayyuggadh ləmelekh mitṣrayim kî våraḥ håʿåm vayyēhåfēkh ləvav parʿōh vaʿavådhåv ʾel-håʿåm vayyōʾmrū mah-zōʾth ʿåsînū kî-shillaḥnū ʾeth-yisråʾēl mēʿåvdhēnū
English: And it was told the king of Egypt that the people fled: and the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was turned against the people, and they said, Why have we done this, that we have let Israel go from serving us?

Hebrew: וַיֶּאְסֹ֖ר אֶת־רִכְבּ֑וֹ וְאֶת־עַמּ֖וֹ לָקַ֥ח עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyeʾsōr ʾeth-rikhbō vəʾeth-ʿammō låqaḥ ʿimmō
English: And he made ready his chariot, and took his people with him:

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֗ח שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת רֶ֨כֶב֙ בָּח֔וּר וְכֹ֖ל רֶ֣כֶב מִצְרָ֑יִם וְשָׁלִשִׁ֖ם עַל־כֻּלּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyiqqaḥ shēsh-mēʾōth rekhev båḥūr vəkhōl rekhev mitṣråyim vəshålishim ʿal-kullō
English: And he took six hundred chosen chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt, and captains over every one of them.

Hebrew: וַיְחַזֵּ֣ק יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־לֵ֤ב פַּרְעֹה֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּרְדֹּ֕ף אַחֲרֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יֹצְאִ֖ים בְּיָ֥ד רָמָֽה׃
Translit: vayḥazzēq ʾadhōnåi ʾeth-lēv parʿōh melekh mitṣrayim vayyirdōf ʾaḥarē bənē yisråʾēl ūvənē yisråʾēl yōtṣəʾîm bəyådh råmåh
English: And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued after the children of Israel: and the children of Israel went out with an high hand.

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפ֨וּ מִצְרַ֜יִם אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם וַיַּשִּׂ֤יגוּ אוֹתָם֙ חֹנִ֣ים עַל־הַיָּ֔ם כָּל־סוּס֙ רֶ֣כֶב פַּרְעֹ֔ה וּפָרָשָׁ֖יו וְחֵיל֑וֹ עַל־פִּי֙ הַֽחִירֹ֔ת לִפְנֵ֖י בַּ֥עַל צְפֹֽן׃
Translit: vayyirdəfū mitṣrayim ʾaḥarēhem vayyassîghū ʾōthåm ḥōnîm ʿal-hayyåm kål-sūs rekhev parʿōh ūfåråshåv vəḥēlō ʿal-pî haḥîrōth lifnē baʿal tṣəfōn
English: But the Egyptians pursued after them, all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, and his horsemen, and his army, and overtook them encamping by the sea, beside Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.

Hebrew: וּפַרְעֹ֖ה הִקְרִ֑יב וַיִּשְׂאוּ֩ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל אֶת־עֵינֵיהֶ֜ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה מִצְרַ֣יִם נֹסֵ֣עַ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם וַיִּֽירְאוּ֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַיִּצְעֲק֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: ūfarʿōh hiqrîv vayyisʾū vənē-yisråʾēl ʾeth-ʿēnēhem vəhinnēh mitṣrayim nōsēaʿ ʾaḥarēhem vayyîrəʾū məʾōdh vayyitṣʿaqū vənē-yisråʾēl ʾel-ʾadhōnåi
English: And when Pharaoh drew nigh, the children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and, behold, the Egyptians marched after them; and they were sore afraid: and the children of Israel cried out unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ הַֽמִבְּלִ֤י אֵין־קְבָרִים֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם לְקַחְתָּ֖נוּ לָמ֣וּת בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר מַה־זֹּאת֙ עָשִׂ֣יתָ לָּ֔נוּ לְהוֹצִיאָ֖נוּ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmərū ʾel-mōsheh hamibbəlî ʾēn-qəvårîm bəmitṣrayim ləqaḥtånū låmūth bammidhbår mah-zōʾth ʿåsîthå lånū ləhōtṣîʾånū mimmitṣråyim
English: And they said unto Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt, hast thou taken us away to die in the wilderness? wherefore hast thou dealt thus with us, to carry us forth out of Egypt?

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבַּ֨רְנוּ אֵלֶ֤יךָ בְמִצְרַ֨יִם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר חֲדַ֥ל מִמֶּ֖נּוּ וְנַֽעַבְדָ֣ה אֶת־מִצְרָ֑יִם כִּ֣י ט֥וֹב לָ֨נוּ֙ עֲבֹ֣ד אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם מִמֻּתֵ֖נוּ בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translit: halōʾ-zeh haddåvår ʾasher dibbarnū ʾēlekhå vəmitṣrayim lēʾmōr ḥadhal mimmennū vənaʿavdhåh ʾeth-mitṣråyim kî ṭōv lånū ʿavōdh ʾeth-mitṣrayim mimmuthēnū bammidhbår-
English: Is not this the word that we did tell thee in Egypt, saying, Let us alone, that we may serve the Egyptians? For it had been better for us to serve the Egyptians, than that we should die in the wilderness.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶל־הָעָם֮ אַל־תִּירָאוּ֒ הִֽתְיַצְב֗וּ וּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־יְשׁוּעַ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם כִּ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר רְאִיתֶ֤ם אֶת־מִצְרַ֨יִם֙ הַיּ֔וֹם לֹ֥א תֹסִ֛יפוּ לִרְאֹתָ֥ם ע֖וֹד עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾel-håʿåm ʾal-tîråʾū hithyatṣvū ūrəʾū ʾeth-yəshūʿath ʾadhōnåi ʾasher-yaʿaseh låkhem hayyōm kî ʾasher rəʾîthem ʾeth-mitṣrayim hayyōm lōʾ thōsîfū lirʾōthåm ʿōdh ʿadh-ʿōlåm
English: And Moses said unto the people, Fear ye not, stand still, and see the salvation of the LORD, which he will shew to you to day: for the Egyptians whom ye have seen to day, ye shall see them again no more for ever.

Hebrew: יְהוָ֖ה יִלָּחֵ֣ם לָכֶ֑ם וְאַתֶּ֖ם תַּחֲרִישֽׁוּן׃
Translit: ʾadhōnåi yillåḥēm låkhem vəʾattem taḥarîshūn
English: The LORD shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מַה־תִּצְעַ֖ק אֵלָ֑י דַּבֵּ֥ר אֶל־בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְיִסָּֽעוּ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh mah-titṣʿaq ʾēlåi dabbēr ʾel-bənē-yisråʾēl vəyissåʿū
English: And the LORD said unto Moses, Wherefore criest thou unto me? speak unto the children of Israel, that they go forward:

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֞ה הָרֵ֣ם אֶֽת־מַטְּךָ֗ וּנְטֵ֧ה אֶת־יָדְךָ֛ עַל־הַיָּ֖ם וּבְקָעֵ֑הוּ וְיָבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּ֖ם בַּיַּבָּשָֽׁה׃
Translit: vəʾattåh hårēm ʾeth-maṭṭəkhå ūnəṭēh ʾeth-yådhkhå ʿal-hayyåm ūvəqåʿēhū vəyåvōʾū vənē-yisråʾēl bəthōkh hayyåm bayyabbåshåh
English: But lift thou up thy rod, and stretch out thine hand over the sea, and divide it: and the children of Israel shall go on dry ground through the midst of the sea.

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנְנִ֤י מְחַזֵּק֙ אֶת־לֵ֣ב מִצְרַ֔יִם וְיָבֹ֖אוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וְאִכָּבְדָ֤ה בְּפַרְעֹה֙ וּבְכָל־חֵיל֔וֹ בְּרִכְבּ֖וֹ וּבְפָרָשָֽׁיו׃
Translit: vaʾanî hinnî məḥazzēq ʾeth-lēv mitṣrayim vəyåvōʾū ʾaḥarēhem vəʾikkåvdhåh bəfarʿōh ūvəkhål-ḥēlō bərikhbō ūvəfåråshåv
English: And I, behold, I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians, and they shall follow them: and I will get me honour upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.

Hebrew: וְיָדְע֥וּ מִצְרַ֖יִם כִּי־אֲנִ֣י יְהוָ֑ה בְּהִכָּבְדִ֣י בְּפַרְעֹ֔ה בְּרִכְבּ֖וֹ וּבְפָרָשָֽׁיו׃
Translit: vəyådhʿū mitṣrayim kî-ʾanî ʾadhōnåi bəhikkåvdhî bəfarʿōh bərikhbō ūvəfåråshåv
English: And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I have gotten me honour upon Pharaoh, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.

Hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֞ע מַלְאַ֣ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים הַהֹלֵךְ֙ לִפְנֵי֙ מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּסַּ֞ע עַמּ֤וּד הֶֽעָנָן֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיַּֽעֲמֹ֖ד מֵאַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translit: vayyissaʿ malʾakh håʾelōhîm hahōlēkh lifnē maḥanēh yisråʾēl vayyēlekh mēʾaḥarēhem vayyissaʿ ʿammūdh heʿånån mippənēhem vayyaʿamōdh mēʾaḥarēhem
English: And the angel of God, which went before the camp of Israel, removed and went behind them; and the pillar of the cloud went from before their face, and stood behind them:

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֞א בֵּ֣ין מַחֲנֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֗יִם וּבֵין֙ מַחֲנֵ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיְהִ֤י הֶֽעָנָן֙ וְהַחֹ֔שֶׁךְ וַיָּ֖אֶר אֶת־הַלָּ֑יְלָה וְלֹא־קָרַ֥ב זֶ֛ה אֶל־זֶ֖ה כָּל־הַלָּֽיְלָה׃
Translit: vayyåvōʾ bēn maḥanēh mitṣrayim ūvēn maḥanēh yisråʾēl vayhî heʿånån vəhaḥōshekh vayyåʾer ʾeth-hallåylåh vəlōʾ-qårav zeh ʾel-zeh kål-hallåylåh
English: And it came between the camp of the Egyptians and the camp of Israel; and it was a cloud and darkness to them, but it gave light by night to these: so that the one came not near the other all the night.

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨ט מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶת־יָדוֹ֮ עַל־הַיָּם֒ וַיּ֣וֹלֶךְ יְהוָ֣ה אֶת־הַ֠יָּם בְּר֨וּחַ קָדִ֤ים עַזָּה֙ כָּל־הַלַּ֔יְלָה וַיָּ֥שֶׂם אֶת־הַיָּ֖ם לֶחָרָבָ֑ה וַיִּבָּקְע֖וּ הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyēṭ mōsheh ʾeth-yådhō ʿal-hayyåm vayyōlekh ʾadhōnåi ʾeth-hayyåm bərūaḥ qådhîm ʿazzåh kål-hallaylåh vayyåsem ʾeth-hayyåm leḥåråvåh vayyibbåqʿū hammåyim
English: And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea; and the LORD caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּ֖ם בַּיַּבָּשָׁ֑ה וְהַמַּ֤יִם לָהֶם֙ חֹמָ֔ה מִֽימִינָ֖ם וּמִשְּׂמֹאלָֽם׃
Translit: vayyåvōʾū vənē-yisråʾēl bəthōkh hayyåm bayyabbåshåh vəhammayim låhem ḥōmåh mîmînåm ūmissəmōʾlåm
English: And the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground: and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדְּפ֤וּ מִצְרַ֨יִם֙ וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ם כֹּ֚ל ס֣וּס פַּרְעֹ֔ה רִכְבּ֖וֹ וּפָרָשָׁ֑יו אֶל־תּ֖וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃
Translit: vayyirdəfū mitṣrayim vayyåvōʾū ʾaḥarēhem kōl sūs parʿōh rikhbō ūfåråshåv ʾel-tōkh hayyåm
English: And the Egyptians pursued, and went in after them to the midst of the sea, even all Pharaoh's horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בְּאַשְׁמֹ֣רֶת הַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיַּשְׁקֵ֤ף יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מַחֲנֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ וְעָנָ֑ן וַיָּ֕הָם אֵ֖ת מַחֲנֵ֥ה מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: vayhî bəʾashmōreth habbōqer vayyashqēf ʾadhōnåi ʾel-maḥanēh mitṣrayim bəʿammūdh ʾēsh vəʿånån vayyåhåm ʾēth maḥanēh mitṣråyim
English: And it came to pass, that in the morning watch the LORD looked unto the host of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire and of the cloud, and troubled the host of the Egyptians,

Hebrew: וַיָּ֗סַר אֵ֚ת אֹפַ֣ן מַרְכְּבֹתָ֔יו וַֽיְנַהֲגֵ֖הוּ בִּכְבֵדֻ֑ת וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מִצְרַ֗יִם אָנ֨וּסָה֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֣י יְהוָ֔ה נִלְחָ֥ם לָהֶ֖ם בְּמִצְרָֽיִם
Translit: vayyåsar ʾēth ʾōfan markəvōthåv vaynahaghēhū bikhvēdhuth vayyōʾmer mitṣrayim ʾånūsåh mippənē yisråʾēl kî ʾadhōnåi nilḥåm låhem bəmitṣråyim
English: And took off their chariot wheels, that they drave them heavily: so that the Egyptians said, Let us flee from the face of Israel; for the LORD fighteth for them against the Egyptians.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה נְטֵ֥ה אֶת־יָדְךָ֖ עַל־הַיָּ֑ם וְיָשֻׁ֤בוּ הַמַּ֨יִם֙ עַל־מִצְרַ֔יִם עַל־רִכְבּ֖וֹ וְעַל־פָּרָשָֽׁיו׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh nəṭēh ʾeth-yådhkhå ʿal-hayyåm vəyåshuvū hammayim ʿal-mitṣrayim ʿal-rikhbō vəʿal-påråshåv
English: And the LORD said unto Moses, Stretch out thine hand over the sea, that the waters may come again upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen.

Hebrew: וַיֵּט֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה אֶת־יָד֜וֹ עַל־הַיָּ֗ם וַיָּ֨שָׁב הַיָּ֜ם לִפְנ֥וֹת בֹּ֨קֶר֙ לְאֵ֣יתָנ֔וֹ וּמִצְרַ֖יִם נָסִ֣ים לִקְרָאת֑וֹ וַיְנַעֵ֧ר יְהוָ֛ה אֶת־מִצְרַ֖יִם בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃
Translit: vayyēṭ mōsheh ʾeth-yådhō ʿal-hayyåm vayyåshåv hayyåm lifnōth bōqer ləʾēthånō ūmitṣrayim nåsîm liqråʾthō vaynaʿēr ʾadhōnåi ʾeth-mitṣrayim bəthōkh hayyåm
English: And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to his strength when the morning appeared; and the Egyptians fled against it; and the LORD overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֣בוּ הַמַּ֗יִם וַיְכַסּ֤וּ אֶת־הָרֶ֨כֶב֙ וְאֶת־הַפָּ֣רָשִׁ֔ים לְכֹל֙ חֵ֣יל פַּרְעֹ֔ה הַבָּאִ֥ים אַחֲרֵיהֶ֖ם בַּיָּ֑ם לֹֽא־נִשְׁאַ֥ר בָּהֶ֖ם עַד־אֶחָֽד׃
Translit: vayyåshuvū hammayim vaykhassū ʾeth-hårekhev vəʾeth-happåråshîm ləkhōl ḥēl parʿōh habbåʾîm ʾaḥarēhem bayyåm lōʾ-nishʾar båhem ʿadh-ʾeḥådh
English: And the waters returned, and covered the chariots, and the horsemen, and all the host of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them; there remained not so much as one of them.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָלְכ֥וּ בַיַּבָּשָׁ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ הַיָּ֑ם וְהַמַּ֤יִם לָהֶם֙ חֹמָ֔ה מִֽימִינָ֖ם וּמִשְּׂמֹאלָֽם
Translit: ūvənē yisråʾēl hålkhū vayyabbåshåh bəthōkh hayyåm vəhammayim låhem ḥōmåh mîmînåm ūmissəmōʾlåm
English: But the children of Israel walked upon dry land in the midst of the sea; and the waters were a wall unto them on their right hand, and on their left.

Hebrew: וַיּ֨וֹשַׁע יְהוָ֜ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֛וּא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִיַּ֣ד מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיַּ֤רְא יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם מֵ֖ת עַל־שְׂפַ֥ת הַיָּֽם׃
Translit: vayyōshaʿ ʾadhōnåi bayyōm hahūʾ ʾeth-yisråʾēl miyyadh mitṣråyim vayyarʾ yisråʾēl ʾeth-mitṣrayim mēth ʿal-səfath hayyåm
English: Thus the LORD saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the sea shore.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨רְא יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־הַיָּ֣ד הַגְּדֹלָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה יְהוָה֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּֽירְא֥וּ הָעָ֖ם אֶת־יְהוָ֑ה וַיַּֽאֲמִ֨ינוּ֙ בַּֽיהוָ֔ה וּבְמֹשֶׁ֖ה עַבְדּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyarʾ yisråʾēl ʾeth-hayyådh haggədhōlåh ʾasher ʿåsåh ʾadhōnåi bəmitṣrayim vayyîrəʾū håʿåm ʾeth-ʾadhōnåi vayyaʾamînū baʾdhōnåi ūvəmōsheh ʿavdō
English: And Israel saw that great work which the LORD did upon the Egyptians: and the people feared the LORD, and believed the LORD, and his servant Moses.

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יָשִֽׁיר־מֹשֶׁה֩ וּבְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־הַשִּׁירָ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ לֵאמֹ֑ר אָשִׁ֤ירָה לַֽיהוָה֙ כִּֽי־גָאֹ֣ה גָּאָ֔ה ס֥וּס וְרֹכְב֖וֹ רָמָ֥ה בַיָּֽם׃
Translit: ʾåz yåshîr-mōsheh ūvənē yisråʾēl ʾeth-hasshîråh hazzōʾth laʾdhōnåi vayyōʾmərū lēʾmōr ʾåshîråh laʾdhōnåi kî-ghåʾōh gåʾåh sūs vərōkhəvō råmåh vayyåm
English: Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto the LORD, and spake, saying, I will sing unto the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.

Hebrew: עָזִּ֤י וְזִמְרָת֙ יָ֔הּ וַֽיְהִי־לִ֖י לִֽישׁוּעָ֑ה זֶ֤ה אֵלִי֙ וְאַנְוֵ֔הוּ אֱלֹהֵ֥י אָבִ֖י וַאֲרֹמְמֶֽנְהוּ׃
Translit: ʿåzzî vəzimråth yåhh vayhî-lî lîshūʿåh zeh ʾēlî vəʾanvēhū ʾelōhē ʾåvî vaʾarōməmenhū
English: The LORD is my strength and song, and he is become my salvation: he is my God, and I will prepare him an habitation; my father's God, and I will exalt him.

Hebrew: יְהוָ֖ה אִ֣ישׁ מִלְחָמָ֑ה יְהוָ֖ה שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾadhōnåi ʾîsh milḥåmåh ʾadhōnåi shəmō
English: The LORD is a man of war: the LORD is his name.

Hebrew: מַרְכְּבֹ֥ת פַּרְעֹ֛ה וְחֵיל֖וֹ יָרָ֣ה בַיָּ֑ם וּמִבְחַ֥ר שָֽׁלִשָׁ֖יו טֻבְּע֥וּ בְיַם־סֽוּף׃
Translit: markəvōth parʿōh vəḥēlō yåråh vayyåm ūmivḥar shålishåv ṭubbəʿū vəyam-sūf
English: Pharaoh's chariots and his host hath he cast into the sea: his chosen captains also are drowned in the Red sea.

Hebrew: תְּהֹמֹ֖ת יְכַסְיֻ֑מוּ יָרְד֥וּ בִמְצוֹלֹ֖ת כְּמוֹ־אָֽבֶן׃
Translit: təhōmōth yəkhasyumū yårdhū vimtṣōlōth kəmō-ʾåven
English: The depths have covered them: they sank into the bottom as a stone.

Hebrew: יְמִֽינְךָ֣ יְהוָ֔ה נֶאְדָּרִ֖י בַּכֹּ֑חַ יְמִֽינְךָ֥ יְהוָ֖ה תִּרְעַ֥ץ אוֹיֵֽב׃
Translit: yəmînəkhå ʾadhōnåi neʾdårî bakkōaḥ yəmînəkhå ʾadhōnåi tirʿatṣ ʾōyēv
English: Thy right hand, O LORD, is become glorious in power: thy right hand, O LORD, hath dashed in pieces the enemy.

Hebrew: וּבְרֹ֥ב גְּאוֹנְךָ֖ תַּהֲרֹ֣ס קָמֶ֑יךָ תְּשַׁלַּח֙ חֲרֹ֣נְךָ֔ יֹאכְלֵ֖מוֹ כַּקַּֽשׁ׃
Translit: ūvərōv gəʾōnəkhå taharōs qåmekhå təshallaḥ ḥarōnəkhå yōʾkhəlēmō kaqqash
English: And in the greatness of thine excellency thou hast overthrown them that rose up against thee: thou sentest forth thy wrath, which consumed them as stubble.

Hebrew: וּבְר֤וּחַ אַפֶּ֨יךָ֙ נֶ֣עֶרְמוּ מַ֔יִם נִצְּב֥וּ כְמוֹ־נֵ֖ד נֹזְלִ֑ים קָֽפְא֥וּ תְהֹמֹ֖ת בְּלֶב־יָֽם׃
Translit: ūvərūaḥ ʾappekhå neʿermū mayim nitṣṣəvū khəmō-nēdh nōzəlîm qåfʾū thəhōmōth bəlev-yåm
English: And with the blast of thy nostrils the waters were gathered together, the floods stood upright as an heap, and the depths were congealed in the heart of the sea.

Hebrew: אָמַ֥ר אוֹיֵ֛ב אֶרְדֹּ֥ף אַשִּׂ֖יג אֲחַלֵּ֣ק שָׁלָ֑ל תִּמְלָאֵ֣מוֹ נַפְשִׁ֔י אָרִ֣יק חַרְבִּ֔י תּוֹרִישֵׁ֖מוֹ יָדִֽי׃
Translit: ʾåmar ʾōyēv ʾerdōf ʾassîgh ʾaḥallēq shålål timlåʾēmō nafshî ʾårîq ḥarbî tōrîshēmō yådhî
English: The enemy said, I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; my lust shall be satisfied upon them; I will draw my sword, my hand shall destroy them.

Hebrew: נָשַׁ֥פְתָּ בְרוּחֲךָ֖ כִּסָּ֣מוֹ יָ֑ם צָֽלֲלוּ֙ כַּֽעוֹפֶ֔רֶת בְּמַ֖יִם אַדִּירִֽים׃
Translit: nåshaftå vərūḥakhå kissåmō yåm tṣålalū kaʿōfereth bəmayim ʾaddîrîm
English: Thou didst blow with thy wind, the sea covered them: they sank as lead in the mighty waters.

Hebrew: מִֽי־כָמֹ֤כָה בָּֽאֵלִם֙ יְהוָ֔ה מִ֥י כָּמֹ֖כָה נֶאְדָּ֣ר בַּקֹּ֑דֶשׁ נוֹרָ֥א תְהִלֹּ֖ת עֹ֥שֵׂה פֶֽלֶא׃
Translit: mî-khåmōkhåh båʾēlim ʾadhōnåi mî kåmōkhåh neʾdår baqqōdhesh nōråʾ thəhillōth ʿōsēh feleʾ-
English: Who is like unto thee, O LORD, among the gods? who is like thee, glorious in holiness, fearful in praises, doing wonders?

Hebrew: נָטִ֨יתָ֙ יְמִ֣ינְךָ֔ תִּבְלָעֵ֖מוֹ אָֽרֶץ׃
Translit: nåṭîthå yəmînəkhå tivlåʿēmō ʾåretṣ
English: Thou stretchedst out thy right hand, the earth swallowed them.

Hebrew: נָחִ֥יתָ בְחַסְדְּךָ֖ עַם־ז֣וּ גָּאָ֑לְתָּ נֵהַ֥לְתָּ בְעָזְּךָ֖ אֶל־נְוֵ֥ה קָדְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translit: nåḥîthå vəḥasdəkhå ʿam-zū gåʾåltå nēhaltå vəʿåzzəkhå ʾel-nəvēh qådhshekhå
English: Thou in thy mercy hast led forth the people which thou hast redeemed: thou hast guided them in thy strength unto thy holy habitation.

Hebrew: שָֽׁמְע֥וּ עַמִּ֖ים יִרְגָּז֑וּן חִ֣יל אָחַ֔ז יֹשְׁבֵ֖י פְּלָֽשֶׁת׃
Translit: shåmʿū ʿammîm yirgåzūn ḥîl ʾåḥaz yōshəvē pəlåsheth
English: The people shall hear, and be afraid: sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of Palestina.

Hebrew: אָ֤ז נִבְהֲלוּ֙ אַלּוּפֵ֣י אֱד֔וֹם אֵילֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב יֹֽאחֲזֵ֖מוֹ רָ֑עַד נָמֹ֕גוּ כֹּ֖ל יֹשְׁבֵ֥י כְנָֽעַן׃
Translit: ʾåz nivhalū ʾallūfē ʾedhōm ʾēlē mōʾåv yōʾḥazēmō råʿadh nåmōghū kōl yōshəvē khənåʿan
English: Then the dukes of Edom shall be amazed; the mighty men of Moab, trembling shall take hold upon them; all the inhabitants of Canaan shall melt away.

Hebrew: תִּפֹּ֨ל עֲלֵיהֶ֤ם אֵימָ֨תָה֙ וָפַ֔חַד בִּגְדֹ֥ל זְרוֹעֲךָ֖ יִדְּמ֣וּ כָּאָ֑בֶן עַד־יַעֲבֹ֤ר עַמְּךָ֙ יְהוָ֔ה עַֽד־יַעֲבֹ֖ר עַם־ז֥וּ קָנִֽיתָ׃
Translit: tippōl ʿalēhem ʾēmåthåh våfaḥadh bighdhōl zərōʿakhå yiddəmū kåʾåven ʿadh-yaʿavōr ʿamməkhå ʾadhōnåi ʿadh-yaʿavōr ʿam-zū qånîthå
English: Fear and dread shall fall upon them; by the greatness of thine arm they shall be as still as a stone; till thy people pass over, O LORD, till the people pass over, which thou hast purchased.

Hebrew: תְּבִאֵ֗מוֹ וְתִטָּעֵ֨מוֹ֙ בְּהַ֣ר נַחֲלָֽתְךָ֔ מָכ֧וֹן לְשִׁבְתְּךָ֛ פָּעַ֖לְתָּ יְהוָ֑ה מִקְּדָ֕שׁ אֲדֹנָ֖י כּוֹנְנ֥וּ יָדֶֽיךָ׃
Translit: təviʾēmō vəthiṭṭåʿēmō bəhar naḥalåthkhå måkhōn ləshivtəkhå påʿaltå ʾadhōnåi miqqədhåsh ʾadhōnåi kōnənū yådhekhå
English: Thou shalt bring them in, and plant them in the mountain of thine inheritance, in the place, O LORD, which thou hast made for thee to dwell in, in the Sanctuary, O Lord, which thy hands have established.

Hebrew: יְהוָ֥ה יִמְלֹ֖ךְ לְעֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
Translit: ʾadhōnåi yimlōkh ləʿōlåm våʿedh
English: The LORD shall reign for ever and ever.

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בָא֩ ס֨וּס פַּרְעֹ֜ה בְּרִכְבּ֤וֹ וּבְפָרָשָׁיו֙ בַּיָּ֔ם וַיָּ֧שֶׁב יְהוָ֛ה עֲלֵהֶ֖ם אֶת־מֵ֣י הַיָּ֑ם וּבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הָלְכ֥וּ בַיַּבָּשָׁ֖ה בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיָּֽם׃
Translit: kî våʾ sūs parʿōh bərikhbō ūvəfåråshåv bayyåm vayyåshev ʾadhōnåi ʿalēhem ʾeth-mē hayyåm ūvənē yisråʾēl hålkhū vayyabbåshåh bəthōkh hayyåm
English: For the horse of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and the LORD brought again the waters of the sea upon them; but the children of Israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea.

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּח֩ מִרְיָ֨ם הַנְּבִיאָ֜ה אֲח֧וֹת אַהֲרֹ֛ן אֶת־הַתֹּ֖ף בְּיָדָ֑הּ וַתֵּצֶ֤אןָ כָֽל־הַנָּשִׁים֙ אַחֲרֶ֔יהָ בְּתֻפִּ֖ים וּבִמְחֹלֹֽת׃
Translit: vattiqqaḥ miryåm hannəvîʾåh ʾaḥōth ʾaharōn ʾeth-hattōf bəyådhåhh vattētṣeʾnå khål-hannåshîm ʾaḥarehå bəthuppîm ūvimḥōlōth
English: And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrels and with dances.

Hebrew: וַתַּ֥עַן לָהֶ֖ם מִרְיָ֑ם שִׁ֤ירוּ לַֽיהוָה֙ כִּֽי־גָאֹ֣ה גָּאָ֔ה ס֥וּס וְרֹכְב֖וֹ רָמָ֥ה בַיָּֽם׃
Translit: vattaʿan låhem miryåm shîrū laʾdhōnåi kî-ghåʾōh gåʾåh sūs vərōkhəvō råmåh vayyåm
English: And Miriam answered them, Sing ye to the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.

Hebrew: וַיַּסַּ֨ע מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִיַּם־ס֔וּף וַיֵּצְא֖וּ אֶל־מִדְבַּר־שׁ֑וּר וַיֵּלְכ֧וּ שְׁלֹֽשֶׁת־יָמִ֛ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר וְלֹא־מָ֥צְאוּ מָֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyassaʿ mōsheh ʾeth-yisråʾēl miyyam-sūf vayyētṣəʾū ʾel-midhbar-shūr vayyēləkhū shəlōsheth-yåmîm bammidhbår vəlōʾ-måtṣʾū måyim
English: So Moses brought Israel from the Red sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur; and they went three days in the wilderness, and found no water.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ מָרָ֔תָה וְלֹ֣א יָֽכְל֗וּ לִשְׁתֹּ֥ת מַ֨יִם֙ מִמָּרָ֔ה כִּ֥י מָרִ֖ים הֵ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרָֽא־שְׁמָ֖הּ מָרָֽה׃
Translit: vayyåvōʾū måråthåh vəlōʾ yåkhlū lishtōth mayim mimmåråh kî mårîm hēm ʿal-kēn qåråʾ-shəmåhh måråh
English: And when they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter: therefore the name of it was called Marah.

Hebrew: וַיִּלֹּ֧נוּ הָעָ֛ם עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹ֖ר מַה־נִּשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translit: vayyillōnū håʿåm ʿal-mōsheh lēʾmōr mah-nishteh
English: And the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?

Hebrew: וַיִּצְעַ֣ק אֶל־יְהוָ֗ה וַיּוֹרֵ֤הוּ יְהוָה֙ עֵ֔ץ וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ֙ אֶל־הַמַּ֔יִם וַֽיִּמְתְּק֖וּ הַמָּ֑יִם שָׁ֣ם שָׂ֥ם ל֛וֹ חֹ֥ק וּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט וְשָׁ֥ם נִסָּֽהוּ׃
Translit: vayyitṣʿaq ʾel-ʾadhōnåi vayyōrēhū ʾadhōnåi ʿētṣ vayyashlēkh ʾel-hammayim vayyimtəqū hammåyim shåm såm lō ḥōq ūmishpåṭ vəshåm nissåhū
English: And he cried unto the LORD; and the LORD shewed him a tree, which when he had cast into the waters, the waters were made sweet: there he made for them a statute and an ordinance, and there he proved them,

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמֶר֩ אִם־שָׁמ֨וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַ֜ע לְק֣וֹל יְהוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ וְהַיָּשָׁ֤ר בְּעֵינָיו֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְהַֽאֲזַנְתָּ֙ לְמִצְוֺתָ֔יו וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֖ כָּל־חֻקָּ֑יו כָּֽל־הַמַּֽחֲלָ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־שַׂ֤מְתִּי בְמִצְרַ֨יִם֙ לֹא־אָשִׂ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה רֹפְאֶֽךָ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾim-shåmōaʿ tishmaʿ ləqōl ʾadhōnåi ʾelōhekhå vəhayyåshår bəʿēnåv taʿaseh vəhaʾazantå ləmitṣvōthåv vəshåmartå kål-ḥuqqåv kål-hammaḥalåh ʾasher-samtî vəmitṣrayim lōʾ-ʾåsîm ʿålekhå kî ʾanî ʾadhōnåi rōfəʾekhå
English: And said, If thou wilt diligently hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, and wilt do that which is right in his sight, and wilt give ear to his commandments, and keep all his statutes, I will put none of these diseases upon thee, which I have brought upon the Egyptians: for I am the LORD that healeth thee.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ אֵילִ֔מָה וְשָׁ֗ם שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֛ה עֵינֹ֥ת מַ֖יִם וְשִׁבְעִ֣ים תְּמָרִ֑ים וַיַּחֲנוּ־שָׁ֖ם עַל־הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyåvōʾū ʾēlimåh vəshåm shətēm ʿesrēh ʿēnōth mayim vəshivʿîm təmårîm vayyaḥanū-shåm ʿal-hammåyim
English: And they came to Elim, where were twelve wells of water, and threescore and ten palm trees: and they encamped there by the waters.

Hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מֵֽאֵילִ֔ם וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ כָּל־עֲדַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶל־מִדְבַּר־סִ֔ין אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּין־אֵילִ֖ם וּבֵ֣ין סִינָ֑י בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר יוֹם֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י לְצֵאתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyisʿū mēʾēlim vayyåvōʾū kål-ʿadhath bənē-yisråʾēl ʾel-midhbar-sîn ʾasher bēn-ʾēlim ūvēn sînåi baḥamisshåh ʿåsår yōm laḥōdhesh hasshēnî lətṣēʾthåm mēʾeretṣ mitṣråyim
English: And they took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came unto the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.

Hebrew: וילינו וַיִּלּ֜וֹנוּ כָּל־עֲדַ֧ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translit: vylynv vayyillōnū kål-ʿadhath bənē-yisråʾēl ʿal-mōsheh vəʿal-ʾaharōn bammidhbår
English: And the whole congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and Aaron in the wilderness:

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֲלֵהֶ֜ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מִֽי־יִתֵּ֨ן מוּתֵ֤נוּ בְיַד־יְהוָה֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּשִׁבְתֵּ֨נוּ֙ עַל־סִ֣יר הַבָּשָׂ֔ר בְּאָכְלֵ֥נוּ לֶ֖חֶם לָשֹׂ֑בַע כִּֽי־הוֹצֵאתֶ֤ם אֹתָ֨נוּ֙ אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה לְהָמִ֛ית אֶת־כָּל־הַקָּהָ֥ל הַזֶּ֖ה בָּרָעָֽב׃
Translit: vayyōʾmərū ʾalēhem bənē yisråʾēl mî-yittēn mūthēnū vəyadh-ʾadhōnåi bəʾeretṣ mitṣrayim bəshivtēnū ʿal-sîr habbåsår bəʾåkhlēnū leḥem låsōvaʿ kî-hōtṣēʾthem ʾōthånū ʾel-hammidhbår hazzeh ləhåmîth ʾeth-kål-haqqåhål hazzeh båråʿåv
English: And the children of Israel said unto them, Would to God we had died by the hand of the LORD in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the flesh pots, and when we did eat bread to the full; for ye have brought us forth into this wilderness, to kill this whole assembly with hunger.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הִנְנִ֨י מַמְטִ֥יר לָכֶ֛ם לֶ֖חֶם מִן־הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְיָצָ֨א הָעָ֤ם וְלָֽקְטוּ֙ דְּבַר־י֣וֹם בְּיוֹמ֔וֹ לְמַ֧עַן אֲנַסֶּ֛נּוּ הֲיֵלֵ֥ךְ בְּתוֹרָתִ֖י אִם־לֹֽא׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh hinnî mamṭîr låkhem leḥem min-hasshåmåyim vəyåtṣåʾ håʿåm vəlåqṭū dəvar-yōm bəyōmō ləmaʿan ʾanassennū hayēlēkh bəthōråthî ʾim-lōʾ
English: Then said the LORD unto Moses, Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you; and the people shall go out and gather a certain rate every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law, or no.

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔י וְהֵכִ֖ינוּ אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־יָבִ֑יאוּ וְהָיָ֣ה מִשְׁנֶ֔ה עַ֥ל אֲשֶֽׁר־יִלְקְט֖וּ י֥וֹם יֽוֹם׃
Translit: vəhåyåh bayyōm hasshisshî vəhēkhînū ʾēth ʾasher-yåvîʾū vəhåyåh mishneh ʿal ʾasher-yilqəṭū yōm yōm
English: And it shall come to pass, that on the sixth day they shall prepare that which they bring in; and it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן אֶֽל־כָּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עֶ֕רֶב וִֽידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֧י יְהוָ֛ה הוֹצִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh vəʾaharōn ʾel-kål-bənē yisråʾēl ʿerev vîdhaʿtem kî ʾadhōnåi hōtṣîʾ ʾethkhem mēʾeretṣ mitṣråyim
English: And Moses and Aaron said unto all the children of Israel, At even, then ye shall know that the LORD hath brought you out from the land of Egypt:

Hebrew: וּבֹ֗קֶר וּרְאִיתֶם֙ אֶת־כְּב֣וֹד יְהוָ֔ה בְּשָׁמְע֥וֹ אֶת־תְּלֻנֹּתֵיכֶ֖ם עַל־יְהוָ֑ה וְנַ֣חְנוּ מָ֔ה כִּ֥י תלונו תַלִּ֖ינוּ עָלֵֽינוּ׃
Translit: ūvōqer ūrəʾîthem ʾeth-kəvōdh ʾadhōnåi bəshåmʿō ʾeth-təlunnōthēkhem ʿal-ʾadhōnåi vənaḥnū måh kî thlvnv thallînū ʿålēnū
English: And in the morning, then ye shall see the glory of the LORD; for that he heareth your murmurings against the LORD: and what are we, that ye murmur against us?

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה בְּתֵ֣ת יְהוָה֩ לָכֶ֨ם בָּעֶ֜רֶב בָּשָׂ֣ר לֶאֱכֹ֗ל וְלֶ֤חֶם בַּבֹּ֨קֶר֙ לִשְׂבֹּ֔עַ בִּשְׁמֹ֤עַ יְהוָה֙ אֶת־תְּלֻנֹּ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם מַלִּינִ֖ם עָלָ֑יו וְנַ֣חְנוּ מָ֔ה לֹא־עָלֵ֥ינוּ תְלֻנֹּתֵיכֶ֖ם כִּ֥י עַל־יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh bəthēth ʾadhōnåi låkhem båʿerev båsår leʾekhōl vəleḥem babbōqer lisbōaʿ bishmōaʿ ʾadhōnåi ʾeth-təlunnōthēkhem ʾasher-ʾattem mallînim ʿålåv vənaḥnū måh lōʾ-ʿålēnū thəlunnōthēkhem kî ʿal-ʾadhōnåi
English: And Moses said, This shall be, when the LORD shall give you in the evening flesh to eat, and in the morning bread to the full; for that the LORD heareth your murmurings which ye murmur against him: and what are we? your murmurings are not against us, but against the LORD.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֱמֹ֗ר אֶֽל־כָּל־עֲדַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל קִרְב֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה כִּ֣י שָׁמַ֔ע אֵ֖ת תְּלֻנֹּתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾel-ʾaharōn ʾemōr ʾel-kål-ʿadhath bənē yisråʾēl qirvū lifnē ʾadhōnåi kî shåmaʿ ʾēth təlunnōthēkhem
English: And Moses spake unto Aaron, Say unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, Come near before the LORD: for he hath heard your murmurings.

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּדַבֵּ֤ר אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־כָּל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּפְנ֖וּ אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְהִנֵּה֙ כְּב֣וֹד יְהוָ֔ה נִרְאָ֖ה בֶּעָנָֽן׃
Translit: vayhî kədhabbēr ʾaharōn ʾel-kål-ʿadhath bənē-yisråʾēl vayyifnū ʾel-hammidhbår vəhinnēh kəvōdh ʾadhōnåi nirʾåh beʿånån
English: And it came to pass, as Aaron spake unto the whole congregation of the children of Israel, that they looked toward the wilderness, and, behold, the glory of the LORD appeared in the cloud.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי אֶת־תְּלוּנֹּת֮ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ דַּבֵּ֨ר אֲלֵהֶ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר בֵּ֤ין הָֽעַרְבַּ֨יִם֙ תֹּאכְל֣וּ בָשָׂ֔ר וּבַבֹּ֖קֶר תִּשְׂבְּעוּ־לָ֑חֶם וִֽידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translit: shåmaʿtî ʾeth-təlūnōth bənē yisråʾēl dabbēr ʾalēhem lēʾmōr bēn håʿarbayim tōʾkhəlū våsår ūvabbōqer tisbəʿū-låḥem vîdhaʿtem kî ʾanî ʾadhōnåi ʾelōhēkhem
English: I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel: speak unto them, saying, At even ye shall eat flesh, and in the morning ye shall be filled with bread; and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God.

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בָעֶ֔רֶב וַתַּ֣עַל הַשְּׂלָ֔ו וַתְּכַ֖ס אֶת־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וּבַבֹּ֗קֶר הָֽיְתָה֙ שִׁכְבַ֣ת הַטַּ֔ל סָבִ֖יב לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translit: vayhî våʿerev vattaʿal hassəlåv vattəkhas ʾeth-hammaḥaneh ūvabbōqer håythåh shikhvath haṭṭal såvîv lammaḥaneh
English: And it came to pass, that at even the quails came up, and covered the camp: and in the morning the dew lay round about the host.

Hebrew: וַתַּ֖עַל שִׁכְבַ֣ת הַטָּ֑ל וְהִנֵּ֞ה עַל־פְּנֵ֤י הַמִּדְבָּר֙ דַּ֣ק מְחֻסְפָּ֔ס דַּ֥ק כַּכְּפֹ֖ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translit: vattaʿal shikhvath haṭṭål vəhinnēh ʿal-pənē hammidhbår daq məḥusəpås daq kakkəfōr ʿal-håʾåretṣ
English: And when the dew that lay was gone up, behold, upon the face of the wilderness there lay a small round thing, as small as the hoar frost on the ground.

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֣וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ אִ֤ישׁ אֶל־אָחִיו֙ מָ֣ן ה֔וּא כִּ֛י לֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ מַה־ה֑וּא וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם ה֣וּא הַלֶּ֔חֶם אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧ן יְהוָ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם לְאָכְלָֽה׃
Translit: vayyirʾū vənē-yisråʾēl vayyōʾmərū ʾîsh ʾel-ʾåḥîv mån hūʾ kî lōʾ yådhʿū mah-hūʾ vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾalēhem hūʾ halleḥem ʾasher nåthan ʾadhōnåi låkhem ləʾåkhlåh
English: And when the children of Israel saw it, they said one to another, It is manna: for they wist not what it was. And Moses said unto them, This is the bread which the LORD hath given you to eat.

Hebrew: זֶ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה לִקְט֣וּ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ אִ֖ישׁ לְפִ֣י אָכְל֑וֹ עֹ֣מֶר לַגֻּלְגֹּ֗לֶת מִסְפַּר֙ נַפְשֹׁ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אִ֛ישׁ לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּאָהֳל֖וֹ תִּקָּֽחוּ׃
Translit: zeh haddåvår ʾasher tṣivvåh ʾadhōnåi liqṭū mimmennū ʾîsh ləfî ʾåkhlō ʿōmer lagguləgōleth mispar nafshōthēkhem ʾîsh laʾasher bəʾåholō tiqqåḥū
English: This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded, Gather of it every man according to his eating, an omer for every man, according to the number of your persons; take ye every man for them which are in his tents.

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֖ן בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיִּלְקְט֔וּ הַמַּרְבֶּ֖ה וְהַמַּמְעִֽיט׃
Translit: vayyaʿasū-khēn bənē yisråʾēl vayyilqəṭū hammarbeh vəhammamʿîṭ-
English: And the children of Israel did so, and gathered, some more, some less.

Hebrew: וַיָּמֹ֣דּוּ בָעֹ֔מֶר וְלֹ֤א הֶעְדִּיף֙ הַמַּרְבֶּ֔ה וְהַמַּמְעִ֖יט לֹ֣א הֶחְסִ֑יר אִ֥ישׁ לְפִֽי־אָכְל֖וֹ לָקָֽטוּ׃
Translit: vayyåmōddū våʿōmer vəlōʾ heʿdîf hammarbeh vəhammamʿîṭ lōʾ heḥsîr ʾîsh ləfî-ʾåkhlō låqåṭū
English: And when they did mete it with an omer, he that gathered much had nothing over, and he that gathered little had no lack; they gathered every man according to his eating.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֕ישׁ אַל־יוֹתֵ֥ר מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾalēhem ʾîsh ʾal-yōthēr mimmennū ʿadh-bōqer
English: And Moses said, Let no man leave of it till the morning.

Hebrew: וְלֹא־שָׁמְע֣וּ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיּוֹתִ֨רוּ אֲנָשִׁ֤ים מִמֶּ֨נּוּ֙ עַד־בֹּ֔קֶר וַיָּ֥רֻם תּוֹלָעִ֖ים וַיִּבְאַ֑שׁ וַיִּקְצֹ֥ף עֲלֵהֶ֖ם מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translit: vəlōʾ-shåmʿū ʾel-mōsheh vayyōthirū ʾanåshîm mimmennū ʿadh-bōqer vayyårum tōlåʿîm vayyivʾash vayyiqtṣōf ʿalēhem mōsheh-
English: Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and stank: and Moses was wroth with them.

Hebrew: וַיִּלְקְט֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֔קֶר אִ֖ישׁ כְּפִ֣י אָכְל֑וֹ וְחַ֥ם הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ וְנָמָֽס׃
Translit: vayyilqəṭū ʾōthō babbōqer babbōqer ʾîsh kəfî ʾåkhlō vəḥam hasshemesh vənåmås
English: And they gathered it every morning, every man according to his eating: and when the sun waxed hot, it melted.

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֗י לָֽקְט֥וּ לֶ֨חֶם֙ מִשְׁנֶ֔ה שְׁנֵ֥י הָעֹ֖מֶר לָאֶחָ֑ד וַיָּבֹ֨אוּ֙ כָּל־נְשִׂיאֵ֣י הָֽעֵדָ֔ה וַיַּגִּ֖ידוּ לְמֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translit: vayhî bayyōm hasshisshî låqṭū leḥem mishneh shənē håʿōmer låʾeḥådh vayyåvōʾū kål-nəsîʾē håʿēdhåh vayyaggîdhū ləmōsheh
English: And it came to pass, that on the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for one man: and all the rulers of the congregation came and told Moses.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם ה֚וּא אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהוָ֔ה שַׁבָּת֧וֹן שַׁבַּת־קֹ֛דֶשׁ לַֽיהוָ֖ה מָחָ֑ר אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאפ֞וּ אֵפ֗וּ וְאֵ֤ת אֲשֶֽׁר־תְּבַשְּׁלוּ֙ בַּשֵּׁ֔לוּ וְאֵת֙ כָּל־הָ֣עֹדֵ֔ף הַנִּ֧יחוּ לָכֶ֛ם לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת עַד־הַבֹּֽקֶר׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾalēhem hūʾ ʾasher dibber ʾadhōnåi shabbåthōn shabbath-qōdhesh laʾdhōnåi måḥår ʾēth ʾasher-tōʾfū ʾēfū vəʾēth ʾasher-təvasshəlū basshēlū vəʾēth kål-håʿōdhēf hannîḥū låkhem ləmishmereth ʿadh-habbōqer
English: And he said unto them, This is that which the LORD hath said, To morrow is the rest of the holy sabbath unto the LORD: bake that which ye will bake to day, and seethe that ye will seethe; and that which remaineth over lay up for you to be kept until the morning.

Hebrew: וַיַּנִּ֤יחוּ אֹתוֹ֙ עַד־הַבֹּ֔קֶר כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְלֹ֣א הִבְאִ֔ישׁ וְרִמָּ֖ה לֹא־הָ֥יְתָה בּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyannîḥū ʾōthō ʿadh-habbōqer kaʾasher tṣivvåh mōsheh vəlōʾ hivʾîsh vərimmåh lōʾ-håythåh bō
English: And they laid it up till the morning, as Moses bade: and it did not stink, neither was there any worm therein.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אִכְלֻ֣הוּ הַיּ֔וֹם כִּֽי־שַׁבָּ֥ת הַיּ֖וֹם לַיהוָ֑ה הַיּ֕וֹם לֹ֥א תִמְצָאֻ֖הוּ בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾikhluhū hayyōm kî-shabbåth hayyōm laʾdhōnåi hayyōm lōʾ thimtṣåʾuhū bassådheh
English: And Moses said, Eat that to day; for to day is a sabbath unto the LORD: to day ye shall not find it in the field.

Hebrew: שֵׁ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים תִּלְקְטֻ֑הוּ וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֛י שַׁבָּ֖ת לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־בּֽוֹ׃
Translit: shēsheth yåmîm tilqəṭuhū ūvayyōm hasshəvîʿî shabbåth lōʾ yihyeh-bō
English: Six days ye shall gather it; but on the seventh day, which is the sabbath, in it there shall be none.

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י יָצְא֥וּ מִן־הָעָ֖ם לִלְקֹ֑ט וְלֹ֖א מָצָֽאוּ׃
Translit: vayhî bayyōm hasshəvîʿî yåtṣʾū min-håʿåm lilqōṭ vəlōʾ måtṣåʾū
English: And it came to pass, that there went out some of the people on the seventh day for to gather, and they found none.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה עַד־אָ֨נָה֙ מֵֽאַנְתֶּ֔ם לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מִצְוֺתַ֖י וְתוֹרֹתָֽי׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh ʿadh-ʾånåh mēʾantem lishmōr mitṣvōthai vəthōrōthåi
English: And the LORD said unto Moses, How long refuse ye to keep my commandments and my laws?

Hebrew: רְא֗וּ כִּֽי־יְהוָה֮ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֣ם הַשַּׁבָּת֒ עַל־כֵּ֠ן ה֣וּא נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֛ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֖י לֶ֣חֶם יוֹמָ֑יִם שְׁב֣וּ אִ֣ישׁ תַּחְתָּ֗יו אַל־יֵ֥צֵא אִ֛ישׁ מִמְּקֹמ֖וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִֽי׃
Translit: rəʾū kî-ʾadhōnåi nåthan låkhem hasshabbåth ʿal-kēn hūʾ nōthēn låkhem bayyōm hasshisshî leḥem yōmåyim shəvū ʾîsh taḥtåv ʾal-yētṣēʾ ʾîsh mimməqōmō bayyōm hasshəvîʿî
English: See, for that the LORD hath given you the sabbath, therefore he giveth you on the sixth day the bread of two days; abide ye every man in his place, let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁבְּת֥וּ הָעָ֖ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִעִֽי׃
Translit: vayyishbəthū håʿåm bayyōm hasshəviʿî
English: So the people rested on the seventh day.

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרְא֧וּ בֵֽית־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ מָ֑ן וְה֗וּא כְּזֶ֤רַע גַּד֙ לָבָ֔ן וְטַעְמ֖וֹ כְּצַפִּיחִ֥ת בִּדְבָֽשׁ׃
Translit: vayyiqrəʾū vēth-yisråʾēl ʾeth-shəmō mån vəhūʾ kəzeraʿ gadh låvån vəṭaʿmō kətṣappîḥith bidhvåsh
English: And the house of Israel called the name thereof Manna: and it was like coriander seed, white; and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה זֶ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהוָ֔ה מְלֹ֤א הָעֹ֨מֶר֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֑ם לְמַ֣עַן יִרְא֣וּ אֶת־הַלֶּ֗חֶם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶאֱכַ֤לְתִּי אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר בְּהוֹצִיאִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh zeh haddåvår ʾasher tṣivvåh ʾadhōnåi məlōʾ håʿōmer mimmennū ləmishmereth lədhōrōthēkhem ləmaʿan yirʾū ʾeth-halleḥem ʾasher heʾekhaltî ʾethkhem bammidhbår bəhōtṣîʾî ʾethkhem mēʾeretṣ mitṣråyim
English: And Moses said, This is the thing which the LORD commandeth, Fill an omer of it to be kept for your generations; that they may see the bread wherewith I have fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you forth from the land of Egypt.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קַ֚ח צִנְצֶ֣נֶת אַחַ֔ת וְתֶן־שָׁ֥מָּה מְלֹֽא־הָעֹ֖מֶר מָ֑ן וְהַנַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֔ה לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾel-ʾaharōn qaḥ tṣintṣeneth ʾaḥath vəthen-shåmmåh məlōʾ-håʿōmer mån vəhannaḥ ʾōthō lifnē ʾadhōnåi ləmishmereth lədhōrōthēkhem
English: And Moses said unto Aaron, Take a pot, and put an omer full of manna therein, and lay it up before the LORD, to be kept for your generations.

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיַּנִּיחֵ֧הוּ אַהֲרֹ֛ן לִפְנֵ֥י הָעֵדֻ֖ת לְמִשְׁמָֽרֶת׃
Translit: kaʾasher tṣivvåh ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh vayyannîḥēhū ʾaharōn lifnē håʿēdhuth ləmishmåreth
English: As the LORD commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אָֽכְל֤וּ אֶת־הַמָּן֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה עַד־בֹּאָ֖ם אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ נוֹשָׁ֑בֶת אֶת־הַמָּן֙ אָֽכְל֔וּ עַד־בֹּאָ֕ם אֶל־קְצֵ֖ה אֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translit: ūvənē yisråʾēl ʾåkhlū ʾeth-hammån ʾarbåʿîm shånåh ʿadh-bōʾåm ʾel-ʾeretṣ nōshåveth ʾeth-hammån ʾåkhlū ʿadh-bōʾåm ʾel-qətṣēh ʾeretṣ kənåʿan
English: And the children of Israel did eat manna forty years, until they came to a land inhabited; they did eat manna, until they came unto the borders of the land of Canaan.

Hebrew: וְהָעֹ֕מֶר עֲשִׂרִ֥ית הָאֵיפָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translit: vəhåʿōmer ʿasirîth håʾēfåh hūʾ
English: Now an omer is the tenth part of an ephah.

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּסְעוּ כָּל־עֲדַ֨ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל מִמִּדְבַּר־סִ֛ין לְמַסְעֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־פִּ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בִּרְפִידִ֔ים וְאֵ֥ין מַ֖יִם לִשְׁתֹּ֥ת הָעָֽם׃
Translit: vayyisʿū kål-ʿadhath bənē-yisråʾēl mimmidhbar-sîn ləmasʿēhem ʿal-pî ʾadhōnåi vayyaḥanū birfîdhîm vəʾēn mayim lishtōth håʿåm
English: And all the congregation of the children of Israel journeyed from the wilderness of Sin, after their journeys, according to the commandment of the LORD, and pitched in Rephidim: and there was no water for the people to drink.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤רֶב הָעָם֙ עִם־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ תְּנוּ־לָ֥נוּ מַ֖יִם וְנִשְׁתֶּ֑ה וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה מַה־תְּרִיבוּן֙ עִמָּדִ֔י מַה־תְּנַסּ֖וּן אֶת־יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vayyårev håʿåm ʿim-mōsheh vayyōʾmərū tənū-lånū mayim vənishteh vayyōʾmer låhem mōsheh mah-tərîvūn ʿimmådhî mah-tənassūn ʾeth-ʾadhōnåi
English: Wherefore the people did chide with Moses, and said, Give us water that we may drink. And Moses said unto them, Why chide ye with me? wherefore do ye tempt the LORD?

Hebrew: וַיִּצְמָ֨א שָׁ֤ם הָעָם֙ לַמַּ֔יִם וַיָּ֥לֶן הָעָ֖ם עַל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לָ֤מָּה זֶּה֙ הֶעֱלִיתָ֣נוּ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם לְהָמִ֥ית אֹתִ֛י וְאֶת־בָּנַ֥י וְאֶת־מִקְנַ֖י בַּצָּמָֽא׃
Translit: vayyitṣmåʾ shåm håʿåm lammayim vayyålen håʿåm ʿal-mōsheh vayyōʾmer låmmåh zeh heʿelîthånū mimmitṣrayim ləhåmîth ʾōthî vəʾeth-bånai vəʾeth-miqnai batṣṣåmåʾ
English: And the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Wherefore is this that thou hast brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?

Hebrew: וַיִּצְעַ֤ק מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהוָ֣ה לֵאמֹ֔ר מָ֥ה אֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה ע֥וֹד מְעַ֖ט וּסְקָלֻֽנִי׃
Translit: vayyitṣʿaq mōsheh ʾel-ʾadhōnåi lēʾmōr måh ʾeʿeseh låʿåm hazzeh ʿōdh məʿaṭ ūsəqålunî
English: And Moses cried unto the LORD, saying, What shall I do unto this people? they be almost ready to stone me.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה עֲבֹר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם וְקַ֥ח אִתְּךָ֖ מִזִּקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּמַטְּךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכִּ֤יתָ בּוֹ֙ אֶת־הַיְאֹ֔ר קַ֥ח בְּיָדְךָ֖ וְהָלָֽכְתָּ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh ʿavōr lifnē håʿåm vəqaḥ ʾittəkhå mizziqnē yisråʾēl ūmaṭṭəkhå ʾasher hikkîthå bō ʾeth-hayʾōr qaḥ bəyådhkhå vəhålåkhtå
English: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go on before the people, and take with thee of the elders of Israel; and thy rod, wherewith thou smotest the river, take in thine hand, and go.

Hebrew: הִנְנִ֣י עֹמֵד֩ לְפָנֶ֨יךָ שָּׁ֥ם עַֽל־הַצּוּר֮ בְּחֹרֵב֒ וְהִכִּ֣יתָ בַצּ֗וּר וְיָצְא֥וּ מִמֶּ֛נּוּ מַ֖יִם וְשָׁתָ֣ה הָעָ֑ם וַיַּ֤עַשׂ כֵּן֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֖י זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translit: hinnî ʿōmēdh ləfånekhå shåm ʿal-hatṣṣūr bəḥōrēv vəhikkîthå vatṣṣūr vəyåtṣʾū mimmennū mayim vəshåthåh håʿåm vayyaʿas kēn mōsheh ləʿēnē ziqnē yisråʾēl
English: Behold, I will stand before thee there upon the rock in Horeb; and thou shalt smite the rock, and there shall come water out of it, that the people may drink. And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא֙ שֵׁ֣ם הַמָּק֔וֹם מַסָּ֖ה וּמְרִיבָ֑ה עַל־רִ֣יב בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְעַ֨ל נַסֹּתָ֤ם אֶת־יְהוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הֲיֵ֧שׁ יְהוָ֛ה בְּקִרְבֵּ֖נוּ אִם־אָֽיִן׃
Translit: vayyiqråʾ shēm hammåqōm massåh ūmərîvåh ʿal-rîv bənē yisråʾēl vəʿal nassōthåm ʾeth-ʾadhōnåi lēʾmōr hayēsh ʾadhōnåi bəqirbēnū ʾim-ʾåyin
English: And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the chiding of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֖א עֲמָלֵ֑ק וַיִּלָּ֥חֶם עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בִּרְפִידִֽם׃
Translit: vayyåvōʾ ʿamålēq vayyillåḥem ʿim-yisråʾēl birfîdhim
English: Then came Amalek, and fought with Israel in Rephidim.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֨עַ֙ בְּחַר־לָ֣נוּ אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְצֵ֖א הִלָּחֵ֣ם בַּעֲמָלֵ֑ק מָחָ֗ר אָנֹכִ֤י נִצָּב֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַגִּבְעָ֔ה וּמַטֵּ֥ה הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּיָדִֽי׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer mōsheh ʾel-yəhōshuaʿ bəḥar-lånū ʾanåshîm vətṣēʾ hillåḥēm baʿamålēq måḥår ʾånōkhî nitṣṣåv ʿal-rōʾsh haggivʿåh ūmaṭṭēh håʾelōhîm bəyådhî
English: And Moses said unto Joshua, Choose us out men, and go out, fight with Amalek: to morrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in mine hand.

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר אָֽמַר־לוֹ֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם בַּעֲמָלֵ֑ק וּמֹשֶׁה֙ אַהֲרֹ֣ן וְח֔וּר עָל֖וּ רֹ֥אשׁ הַגִּבְעָֽה׃
Translit: vayyaʿas yəhōshuaʿ kaʾasher ʾåmar-lō mōsheh ləhillåḥēm baʿamålēq ūmōsheh ʾaharōn vəḥūr ʿålū rōʾsh haggivʿåh
English: So Joshua did as Moses had said to him, and fought with Amalek: and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרִ֥ים מֹשֶׁ֛ה יָד֖וֹ וְגָבַ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יָנִ֛יחַ יָד֖וֹ וְגָבַ֥ר עֲמָלֵֽק׃
Translit: vəhåyåh kaʾasher yårîm mōsheh yådhō vəghåvar yisråʾēl vəkhaʾasher yånîaḥ yådhō vəghåvar ʿamålēq
English: And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed: and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.

Hebrew: וִידֵ֤י מֹשֶׁה֙ כְּבֵדִ֔ים וַיִּקְחוּ־אֶ֛בֶן וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ תַחְתָּ֖יו וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב עָלֶ֑יהָ וְאַהֲרֹ֨ן וְח֜וּר תָּֽמְכ֣וּ בְיָדָ֗יו מִזֶּ֤ה אֶחָד֙ וּמִזֶּ֣ה אֶחָ֔ד וַיְהִ֥י יָדָ֛יו אֱמוּנָ֖ה עַד־בֹּ֥א הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translit: vîdhē mōsheh kəvēdhîm vayyiqḥū-ʾeven vayyåsîmū thaḥtåv vayyēshev ʿålehå vəʾaharōn vəḥūr tåmkhū vəyådhåv mizzeh ʾeḥådh ūmizzeh ʾeḥådh vayhî yådhåv ʾemūnåh ʿadh-bōʾ hasshåmesh
English: But Moses' hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat thereon; and Aaron and Hur stayed up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side; and his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.

Hebrew: וַיַּחֲלֹ֧שׁ יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֥ק וְאֶת־עַמּ֖וֹ לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translit: vayyaḥalōsh yəhōshuaʿ ʾeth-ʿamålēq vəʾeth-ʿammō ləfî-ḥårev
English: And Joshua discomfited Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כְּתֹ֨ב זֹ֤את זִכָּרוֹן֙ בַּסֵּ֔פֶר וְשִׂ֖ים בְּאָזְנֵ֣י יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ כִּֽי־מָחֹ֤ה אֶמְחֶה֙ אֶת־זֵ֣כֶר עֲמָלֵ֔ק מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾadhōnåi ʾel-mōsheh kəthōv zōʾth zikkårōn bassēfer vəsîm bəʾåznē yəhōshuaʿ kî-måḥōh ʾemḥeh ʾeth-zēkher ʿamålēq mittaḥath hasshåmåyim
English: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly put out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥בֶן מֹשֶׁ֖ה מִזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ יְהוָ֥ה נִסִּֽי׃
Translit: vayyiven mōsheh mizbēaḥ vayyiqråʾ shəmō ʾadhōnåi nissî
English: And Moses built an altar, and called the name of it Jehovah-nissi:

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר כִּֽי־יָד֙ עַל־כֵּ֣ס יָ֔הּ מִלְחָמָ֥ה לַיהוָ֖ה בַּֽעֲמָלֵ֑ק מִדֹּ֖ר דֹּֽר׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer kî-yådh ʿal-kēs yåhh milḥåmåh laʾdhōnåi baʿamålēq middōr dōr
English: For he said, Because the LORD hath sworn that the LORD will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.
